channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed

item.title: Overwatch‚Äôs New Hero Is Basically Master Chief And Turns The Game Into Halo
item.content:encoded:
One of the best ways to get someone into a hero shooter is to compare a character they don‚Äôt know to one they have intimate knowledge with. I haven‚Äôt played a Halo game in over a decade, so I didn‚Äôt clock that Emre, one of Overwatch‚Äôs new heroes, feels a lot like Master Chief from Bungie‚Äôs classic shooters. But some friends I was playing with last night made the comparison, and then I woke up this morning to find the internet is running wild with it.

Very nice of them to add a Halo guy to Overwatch pic.twitter.com/3IKSLenHXQ

‚Äî bento (comms open!!) (@bentoDRAWS) February 10, 2026

Emre is definitely cut from the Soldier: 76 cloth in that his kit is one of the more straightforward shooter movesets in the game. He‚Äôs got a three-round burst rifle on which he can aim down sights without losing any of his movement speed, a side arm that fires explosive rounds and makes him run fast, and an ultimate that lets him fly and rain fire down on his enemies. But he also has frag grenades that bounce around just like Master Chief‚Äôs do in Halo, and both those and his rifle seem to be immediately activating long-dormant muscle memory for those who haven‚Äôt played as Microsoft‚Äôs mascot for a bit.

If you upgrade his perks accordingly, Emre‚Äôs grenade can also stick to enemies, much like the plasma grenades from Halo, so the comparisons just keep coming. If you were considering getting into Overwatch after its soft reboot this week and don‚Äôt know who to pick first, Emre might be an easy place to start. There are 50 heroes now with varying degrees of complexity, and starting with more simple heroes is a good way to acclimate yourself to all the chaos. Just don‚Äôt panic when you see a flying cat carrying a giant German man with a hammer over the battlefield.



https://kotaku.com/overwatch-new-heroes-emre-halo-master-chief-rifle-grenade-2000667827
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The Secretlab Presidents Day Sale Is Your Chance to Score a Great Deal on the Ultimate Gaming Chair
item.content:encoded:
The Secretlab Presidents Sale has officially commenced and with it are a couple of different promotions that are running concurrently (some are stackable). For starters, you can save up to $139 off across Secretlab's lineup of Titan Evo gaming chairs and Magnus gaming desks, including themed editions from One Piece, Jujutsu Kaisen, Star Wars, Demon Slayer, and more. Secretlab's highest-end gaming chair, the Titan Evo Nanogen, has also ben discounted.

In addition to these instant discounts, you can get extra tiered savings by hitting a certain order amount for each category. These should be stackable with the instant discounts, although some themes are excluded.

  • Extra $40 off Chair orders of $850+ with code "SLEV-MINCPRES26"
  • Extra $50 off Desk orders of $1,489+ with code: "SLEV-MINDPRES26"
  • $100 off all orders of $1,999+ with code: "SLEV-MINSWPRES26"

Finally, Secretlab's Genshin Impact themed gaming chairs gets some love of its own. The Ninguang and and Xiao inspired gaming chairs are on sale as well, to coincide with the Lantern Rite event that's going on right now in-game.

Save $50 off Secretlab Titan Evo gaming chairs

The Titan Evo is Secretlab's most iconic and best selling chair. Over 70 different styles are currently on sale, with prices ranging from $529 to $634 after a $50 off instant discount across the entire lineup. It's available in small, medium, and large sizes, which is great for smaller people because most gaming chairs sold here in the United States are huge. Discounted upholstery optioins include Neo Hybrid leatherette and SoftWeave Plus fabric.

Signature features include a solid steel frame with aluminum wheelbase, firm and supportive cold-cure foam upholstery, adjustable four-way lumbar system, full length backrest with 165 degrees of recline, full metal 4D armrests with magnetically attached PU cushions, and a memory foam headrest pillow. Check out our own glowing Titan Evo review.

Genshin Impact themed chairs see their first discount ever

Secretlab Titan Evo Genshin Edition (Xiao)

Secretlab Titan Evo Genshin Edition (Xiao)

Genshin Impact's annual Lantern Rite in-game event is going on right now, coinciding with the actual Chinese New Year, which lands on February 17. In celebration of the event, Secretlab has discounted two Genshin themed chairs inspired by Liyue characters: Xiao, an anemo adeptus, and Ningguang, the geo-wielding Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing (she's basically a royal). This is the first time a Genshin chair has gone on sale, so if you're a Hoyoverse superfan, don't miss it.

Secretlab's flagship Titan Evo Nanogen is also on sale

Secretlab Titan Evo Nanogen Edition

The Titan Evo Nanogen Edition is Secretlab's highest end chair and is rarely discounted. It normally sells for $799 at Secretlab direct, but both the white and black colors have been discounted by $50 during the Presidents Day Sale. If your budget can accomodate it, this is the best gaming chair. In our recent Titan Evo Nanogen Edition review, Chris Coke wrote that "the Secretlab Titan Evo Nanogen Edition deserves every bit of the overwhelming praise I‚Äôve given... The Titan Evo Nanogen Edition is class-leading, and is hands-down the most comfortable gaming chair I‚Äôve ever used."

Sadly, Titan Evo Pokemon Edition preorders aren't discounted

Titan Evo Pokemon Eevee Edition

Titan Evo Pokemon Gengar Edition

Titan Evo Pokemon Pikachu Edition

Secretlab's recently announced lineup of Pok√©mon gaming chairs is, not surprisingly, still listed at full price. Even so, these chairs are so cool that they're worth a mention. These chairs showcase one of three iconic Pok√©mon - Gengar, Pikachu, and Eevee - with ostentatious use of color, patterns, and figures. My personal favorite is the Eevee edition, with its detailed embossing of Eevee's myriad evolutions; it also seems to be the top seller, since it's already on its third wave of preorders.

Unusual for a collab, Secretlab opted to go with its Softweave Plus fabric instead of leatherette, and I for one am happy with that decision. Fabric ages more gracefully, feels softer, and doesn't stick to your sweaty skin on hot days.

Save $30 off the Titan Evo recliner add-on (it's worth it)

Secretlab Titan Recliner Add-On

Also on sale for the first time, Secretlab's new recliner add-on is $30 off for Christmas. This is a nice upgrade for anyone who already owns the Titan Evo chair. In our recliner add-on review, Chris Coke wrote that "while both comfort and value are subjective things, the recliner is able to take the Titan Evo and transform it from one of the best racing style gaming chairs to standing head and shoulders above the competition at its price point."

Secretlab Magnus deals are also on sale, including Genshin

Secretlab Magnus

Secretlab Magnus Pro

Secretlab Magnus Pro Genshin Edition

Liyue themed Desk Mat is included

Not only are the Magnus and Magnus Pro discounted for Presidents Day, you also get the desk mat topper (your choice of style) free of charge. The Magnus is a traditional fixed-frame gaming desk while the Magnus Pro ups the ante with practical electric sit-stand functionality. Both desks feature a metal desktop surface, solid steel frame, and clever cable management, but the Magnus Pro has some unique features including a power cable that runs internally inside one of the telescoping legs and an in-line control panel. Check out our Magnus Pr0 review review for hands-on impressions.

Secretlab has the best "racing-style" gaming chairs

It's no secret that we love our Secretlab gaming chairs. Three of the eight chairs in our best gaming chair roundup are Secretlab models. Of all the gaming chairs we covered in our "Budget to Best" roundup video earlier this year, my colleague Akeem Lawanson considered the Secretlab Titan Evo to be the most comfortable. No good chair comes cheap and Secretlab chairs definitely cost a premium, but we think the craftsmanship, materials, and customizability are worth it.

Eric Song is the IGN commerce manager in charge of finding the best gaming and tech deals every day. When Eric isn't hunting for deals for other people at work, he's hunting for deals for himself during his free time.



https://www.ign.com/articles/secretlab-presidents-day-sale-gaming-chair-deals-february-2026

item.title: Jurassic Park: Classic Games Collection To Be Delisted Just Two Years After Release
item.content:encoded:
Extinction

Just over two years after it was released on Switch and other platforms, Limited Run Games' Jurassic Park: Classic Games Collection is getting delisted from digital storefronts. The publisher and distributor announced the news on Steam (thanks Wario64) earlier today.

From 31st March 2026, you'll no longer be able to purchase the game digitally. However, if you already own it (physically or digitally) or buy it before 31st March, you'll be able to redownload and play it at any point.

No reason for the delisting was given, but it's likely due to licensing rights expiring, similar to what happened with Bill & Ted's Excellent Retro Collection a few years back.

Here's Limited Run Games' statement in full:

We wanted to give you an early heads-up that the Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection will no longer be available for purchase on digital storefronts after March 31, 2026.

If you already purchased the game, don‚Äôt worry ‚Äî you‚Äôll still be able to redownload and play it anytime.

In the past, we learned how important it is to provide plenty of notice for changes like this, so we‚Äôre committed to being as open and transparent as possible.

Our goal is to give fans every opportunity to grab the game before it‚Äôs too late. Thanks for understanding!

Jurassic Park: Classic Games Collection came to Switch on 22nd November 2023, so by the time it gets removed from the eShop, it'll have only been out for around two years and four months. The games included are:

  • Jurassic Park (NES)
  • Jurassic Park (Game Boy)
  • Jurassic Park (SNES)
  • Jurassic Park (Genesis / Mega Drive)
  • Jurassic Park Part 2: The Chaos Continues (SNES)
  • Jurassic Park Part 2: The Chaos Continues (Game Boy)
  • Jurassic Park: Rampage Edition (Genesis / Mega Drive)

So, the Collection perhaps isn't the best showing for the iconic dinosaur franchise, but it's a time capsule of 8 - and 16-bit games made in the wake of the 1993 movie's huge success. We acknowledged this as much in our review, scoring the selection a 6/10.

Do you own the Jurassic Park: Classic Games Collection? Surprised by the delisting announcement? Roar in the comments.

[source store.steampowered.com, via bsky.app]

Alana has been with Nintendo Life since 2022, and while RPGs are her first love, Nintendo is a close second. She enjoys nothing more than overthinking battle strategies, characters, and stories. She also wishes she was a Sega air pirate.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/02/jurassic-park-classic-games-collection-to-be-delisted-just-two-years-after-release

item.title: Ubisoft Devs Dance While Striking: ‚ÄòYves Guillemot Has No Knowledge Or Understanding Of His Company‚Äô
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft developers are striking outside the company‚Äôs Paris offices this week. Over 1,200 of them, according to union reps. They‚Äôre dancing, too, as they call on the Assassin‚Äôs Creed maker to reverse its controversial return-to-office policy and call for accountability from its top executives, including co-founder Yves Guillemot.

‚ÄúAt this stage, it seems clear to us that Yves Guillemot has no knowledge or understanding of his company or its employees,‚Äù Solidaires Informatique union representative at Ubisoft Paris Marc Rutschl√© told Gamesindustry.biz. ‚ÄúThe company is continuing its cost reduction and layoff plan. Our teams are already working under pressure, often understaffed. After several years without pay rises (or very small increases), we understand that once again, employees will not receive a raise this year.‚Äù

On February 10, the first day of the this week‚Äôs strike, speakers were blaring the 2014 Game Boy chiptune banger ‚ÄúDisco Sanwa‚Äù by Kenobit. Developers danced even in the rain while protesting the direction of the company.

The three-day strike this week includes developers at Ubisoft Milan as well and comes after the French publisher announced a new emergency pivot that included delaying some big games and cancelling many others. In addition to a fresh cost-cutting program that amounts to another 200 layoffs, and annual raises that have shrunk during hard times, Ubisoft is calling for employees to go back to being in the office full-time by the end of 2026.

That message, delivered by CEO Yves Guillemot in an internal email and recent townhall meetings, has gone over like a lead balloon, not least of all because of the person who‚Äôs delivering it. Despite saying the company needs to change and evolve, Guillemot and his brothers, who founded it back in the 1980s, remain in charge thanks in part to a $1 billion bailout by Tencent.

One employee in Canada was fired for the way he criticized the new policies in work channels, which Ubisoft said violated the company‚Äôs code of conduct. Unlike France, Ubisoft‚Äôs major Canadian studios in Montreal, Quebec, and Toronto are not unionized. Ubisoft‚Äôs smaller mobile gaming team in Canada briefly unionized earlier this year but was subsequently shut down. The company said the closure had nothing to do with the labor organizing.

Unions blamed this week‚Äôs walkout on the ‚Äúarbitrary decision of the CEO who doesn‚Äôt even dare talking to employees anymore.‚Äù



https://kotaku.com/ubisoft-strike-assassins-creed-delay-cancel-rto-layoffs-2000667820
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Marvel Rivals 6.5 Roadmap Details New Events and Costumes
item.content:encoded:
The full Marvel Rivals season 6.5 roadmap has been revealed.

Marvel Rivals season 6.5 is getting ready to launch on February 13. It was previously announced that Elsa Bloodstone would be joining the cast as a new hero. However, the full roadmap has now been released, featuring new events, plenty of costumes, and more.

The rest of the season runs through the start of season 7 on March 20. This will be a collection of highlights from the upcoming roadmap.

New Events Coming to Marvel Rivals in Season 6.5

On February 13, I knew the event would launch surrounding the wedding of Rogue and Gambit. There will also be another event surrounding the monster Kingdom and Deadpool‚Äôs rise as the new Monster King.

February 20 sees the start of the new Monster Kingdom Championship Tournament. That is a Deadpool-hosted tournament, previously announced alongside the season 6.5 full balance notes. There‚Äôs also the start of the Twisted Nightmare and Faulty Dream events.

New Costumes Aplenty

In Season 6.5, there are plenty of costume drops. Captain America and Moon Night will have new costumes related to the Twisted Nightmare event. There are also new costumes for Psylocke and The Thing, among others.

Learn more about Elsa Bloodstone joining the roster here.

NetEase, the developer of Marvel Rivals, recently reported strong financial results. Some of that success was attributed to the implementation of AI. Read more here.

How are you feeling about the Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Roadmap? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Masters Of Albion: Check Out More Than Six Minutes Of New Gameplay For Peter Molyneux's Next (And Final) Game
item.content:encoded:
Masters of Albion, the god-simulator from Fable creator Peter Molyneux, launches on April 22, and ahead of the game's PC release, developer 22 Cans has released nearly seven minutes of all-new gameplay in an extended trailer. The game, which puts players in control of a god-like hand to master real-time strategy, town management, and simulation, also lets players become one of their villages' many NPCs to explore, fight, explore dungeons, and more. 

There's a taste of all that and more in the new trailer, and you can check it out below: 

"Masters of Albion is a bold reimagining of the God Game genre, from the creator who defined it," the trailer's description reads. "Revel in the freedom of true Godhood. In Masters of Albion, there is no single solution. Build whatever, wherever. Hire whoever, wherever. Kill or carry, crush or coax. You are the ultimate power." 

Notably, Masters of Albion will be Molyneux's final game, as he and 22 Cans said when the team announced it during Gamescom 2024. Molyneux, who is the mind behind Populous and Black and White, as well as Fable (the original), said Masters of Albion is "the culmination of my life's work" back when the game was first announced. 

Masters of Albion launches on April 22 exclusively on PC via Steam. 

While waiting for its launch in April, check out the Masters of Albion release date trailer for more details about the simulator's many features and mechanics. 

Are you checking out Masters of Albion in April? Let us know in the comments below!



https://gameinformer.com/2026/02/11/masters-of-albion-check-out-more-than-six-minutes-of-new-gameplay-for-peter-molyneuxs
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: ‚ÄúBolder, Braver, Bloodier‚Äù: CI Games Digs Into Lords of the Fallen 2 Combat in New Developer Deep-Dive
item.content:encoded:
CI Games is getting ready to release its third Lords of the Fallen game with Lords of the Fallen 2, sometime later this year, which we last got a look at during The Game Awards 2025 with a new gameplay trailer. Outside of CI Games' chief executive officer, Marek Tyminski, promising that this fantasy action game won't be "politically correct" and that it will feature female characters in revealing armour, in a new developer deep-dive, game director James Lowe promises that the combat will be "bolder, braver, bloodier."

A quick rundown on the series, if you're confused as to why the game with the '2' at the end of it is actually the third in the franchise. In 2014, CI Games released Lords of the Fallen, an action RPG that failed to really make a big splash. Almost a decade later, the studio decided to reboot the series and released Lords of the Fallen (2023), which, despite its myriad of issues at launch, fared far better. The game's commercial success was enough to drive CI Games to make a sequel, which brings us to Lords of the Fallen 2, due out sometime in 2026, not to be confused with Lords of the Fallen 2.0, which refers to the massive overhaul update CI Games put out almost two years after the 2023 reboot to fix it.

Getting back to today's combat deep-dive, as part of the studio's Lifting the Veil series on its official YouTube channel, CI Games put out a nearly 42-minute video discussing and showcasing how it is improving and updating combat in Lords of the Fallen 2, trying to address players' concerns from its predecessor while also introducing new elements for the sequel.

Some of the highlights about combat that Lowe discusses alongside lead systems designer Daniel Regan, producer Alex Harkin, and creative strategist Ryan Hill include how the team is doubling down on things players loved from the 2023 reboot, like dual-wielding, a great emphasis on players' speed and maneuverability, and a slew of new animations to make combat feel more varied than it did in 2023.

It's not just a greater variety in animations, but in weapon choices, as CI Games is focusing on letting players swap seamlessly between melee attacks to spell casting and back, while also trying out the barrage of new weapons.

The panel discussion is altogether an honest conversation about how the studio is trying to improve and fix the mistakes it made in previous entries. It's clear that CI Games wants to make this game hit in a way that its previous games never did, which is ultimately an exciting proposition for anyone looking forward to checking out this upcoming action RPG.

Another point that Lowe references in the panel is wanting to "respect the player's time," which was something that he told Wccftech that he and the team wanted to focus on back in December 2025, when we got to sit down with him for an interview following its gameplay showcase at The Game Awards.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/bolder-braver-bloodier-ci-games-digs-into-lords-of-the-fallen-2-combat-in-new-developer-deep-dive/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Fortnite x Overwatch Crossover Brings Genji, Tracer, D.Va
item.content:encoded:
The Overwatch x Fortnite content has been revealed by a popular leaker.

Fortnite creator Shiina recently shared more news about the collaboration. In a brief YouTube video and on Twitter, they announced that Genji, Mercy, Tracer, and D.Va would be added to the game as skins.

News of the collaboration first dropped back in late January.

More Collaborations Are on Their Way to Fortnite

Shiina also shared on social media that a Lego collaboration was on the way. A new LEGO Pass is slated to drop on April 16.

In other Fortnite news, it‚Äôs been reported that jam tracks, including Eminem‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Real Slim Shady,‚Äù ‚ÄúFE!N‚Äù by Travis Scott, and ‚ÄúBye Bye Bye,‚Äù have been potentially scrapped.

Overwatch Is Experiencing a Resurgence

Recently, Overwatch announced a major overhaul, returning to its original name and launching a new story arc that will run through 2026. Learn more about ‚ÄúThe Reign of Talon‚Äù at this link.

This move has led to success for the hero shooter, as the game reached an all-time high player count on February 11. Learn more about that here.

Insider Gaming continues to keep track of all of the crossovers coming to Fortnite

Are you excited about the world of Overwatch coming to Fortnite? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Pok√©mon Pokopia Promises A Chunky Main Story With "More Things To Experience" After Credits
item.content:encoded:
Previews for Pok√©mon Pokopia have dropped today, including our own, and most of them are pretty positive, getting us very excited for the upcoming building life-sim on Switch 2. And, according to Takuto Edagawa, the game's director, it sounds like we'll be spending a lot of time rebuilding this abandoned island with our Pok√©mon.

In an interview with IGN, Edagawa ‚Äî who works at Koei Tecmo and previously worked on Dragon Quest Builders 2 and directed the Monster Hunter-like Wild Hearts ‚Äî said that the main aim of the game "is typically not to go to the end roll", meaning the credits.

"The whole concept is to create the world with Pok√©mon and live with the Pok√©mon. However, as an average, it'll be about 20 to 40 hours, but it would really depend on how the players play the game", he told the outlet.

That makes it sound like a pretty chunky game, even if you just focus on the main stuff. And for reference, the Dragon Quest Builders games, which Pokopia seems to be closely-aligned with, are a little longer at 40-50+ hours.

And, as you probably expect from a game like Pokopia, there's a lot more to do than just "roll credits", which Edagawa confirms: "There's more things to experience after the end roll... I believe that players are encouraged to and will be motivated to continue to play the game."

Unsurprising stuff, but that confirms we'll be booking out our March to sit down and thoroughly dedicate ourselves to island rebuilding and repopulating.

When our very own Ollie Reynolds got to play Pokopia, he came away extremely surprised and impressed, and for cosy gamers, he had this to say: "I get the feeling that it's going to scratch an itch for anyone disappointed that we probably won't be getting a brand new Animal Crossing anytime soon."

Are you excited for Pok√©mon Pokopia on 5th March? Catch us in the comments and let us know.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2026/02/pokemon-pokopia-promises-a-chunky-main-story-with-more-things-to-experience-after-credits
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Every New Overwatch Hero & Character In 2026: All Voice Actors, Explained
item.content:encoded:
No one saw the huge rebranding of Overwatch coming in 2026, and the revised identity comes with plenty of actual new identities. We‚Äôre taking a look at every new character, the voice actors behind the fresh-faced heroes, and more.

Aside from the rather unfortunate business surrounding Overwatch‚Äôs Anran undergoing a redesign after community backlash, the new cast of characters has been well-received, particularly a certain flying feline.

Props to Blizzard.

All Overwatch Heroes Added In 2026

Blizzard has added five new Heroes to the rebranded Overwatch in 2026: Anran, Domina, Emre, Jetpack Cat, and Mizuki.

There were the first new faces of 2026, with a few more to be added throughout the year. They range from expert warriors to‚Ä¶a cat‚Ä¶with a jetpack. More cats, please.

Anran

Domina

Emre

Jetpack Cat

Mizuki

Who Voices Anran In Overwatch?

Farheea Andersen is the voice actor for Anran in Overwatch.

  • More Insider Gaming: How To Unlock Crimson Wolf In Overwatch‚ÄîWeapon Variant, Explained

The Twitch streamer and content creator was given the honour of playing Anran for Overwatch, and to be fair to her, she didn‚Äôt hold back in her assessment of Anran‚Äôs original design, citing the character as an ‚ÄòOzempic Chic Character Design.‚Äô

This is believed to be Andersen‚Äôs debut role in gaming, movies, and TV.

Who Voices Domina In Overwatch?

Overwatch‚Äôs Domina is voiced by Taj Atwal.

Atwal is a British actress who has racked up acting credits across a multitude of TV shows, from Line of Duty to Hullraisers. It‚Äôs not her first foray into voice-over work, though, as she played Dr. Neema Chandra in Surgeon Simulator 2!

Who Voices Emre In Overwatch?

Actor Kerem Erdinc has confirmed on social media that he is the voice of Emre.

  • More Insider Gaming: Overwatch 2026 Roadmap‚ÄîAll Overwatch 2026 Content, Explained

In an X post, he said: ‚ÄúThe best thing about being the voice actor for Emre is people just let me pick him in the lobby. Gotta show up for the squad if I‚Äôm the one taking Emre for a spin. First match of the night, play of the game? Oh yeah, me and Emre were made for each other.‚Äù

Erdinc has plenty of other video game work under his belt, including Delta Force, Ready or Not, Wo Long: Fallen Dynasty, and much more.

Who Voices Mizuki In Overwatch?

The masked Mizuki is represented by Julian Cihi.

Unless the facts are wrong, that seems to be Cihi‚Äôs debut into the world of video gaming voice-over work, too! Before grabbing the role of Mizuki with both horns, Cihi has appeared in several shows, such as Only Murders in the Building.

What have you made of the new characters in the 2026 makeover for Overwatch? What kind of new Heroes are you hoping to see in the future? Leave your wild predictions or insider guesswork with IG through the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out all the new content in Overwatch Season 1 (2026), if you haven‚Äôt already.
